      • calculateClassDistance

        public static int calculateClassDistance(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                         java.lang.Class<?> targetClass)
        Calculates the largest distance between the specified Class and the target Class. Only the following combinations are allowed (because they're the only ones the make sense.
        • Both the specified class and the target class are interfaces.
        • Neither the specified class nor the target class are interfaces.
        • The specified class is not an interface, and the target class is an interface.
        In one of these three conditions isn't met, then this method returns -1. And if the specified class does not ultimately implement or extend the targe class, then this method returns -1.

        As an example consider the diagram: 

        .
   a
   |
   b
   |  a
   C /
   |/
   D
        The small letters refer to an interface (a and b are interfaces) and the capital letters refer to classes (C and D are classes). In this diagram, the class D extends C and implements a. The class C, in turn, implements the interface b, which extends the interface a. In this example, the largest calculated distance between the class D and the interface a is 3. Similarly, the largest distance between the class C and the interface a is 2.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The specified class or interface from which to calculate the distance
        targetClass - The target class or interface to which to calculate the distance
        Returns:
        the largest distance between the specified and target class; or -1 if specified class ins't in the hierarchy of the target class
        See Also:
        calculateClassDistance(Class, Class, int)

      • calculateClassDistance

        private static int calculateClassDistance(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,

      • getPersistenceName

        public static java.lang.String getPersistenceName(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                  java.lang.String fieldName)
        Returns the persistence name for the specified Field, or the specified field name if no persistence name is specified in the annotation:
        @Persist( persistName = "xxxx" )
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class containing the field of the specified name
        fieldName - The field name from which to extract the persistence name from the annotation
        Returns:
        the persistence name for the specified Field, or the specified field name if no persistence name is specified in the annotation
        Throws:
        java.lang.ReflectiveOperationException

      • getPersistenceName

        public static java.lang.String getPersistenceName(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
        Returns the persistence name for the specified Field, or null if no persistence name is specified in the annotation:
        @Persist( persistName = "xxxx" )
        Parameters:
        field - The Field for which to return the persistence name
        Returns:
        the persistence name for the specified Field, or null if no persistence

      • getMostSpecificClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getMostSpecificClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                      InfoNode node)
        Returns the Class of the InfoNode object. If the specified Class is a subtype of the Class in the InfoNode, then it uses the specified Class. And vice versa. If the specified Class is not a subtype of the Class found in the InfoNode, then it returns the Class from the InfoNode. If the Class found in the InfoNode is null, then returns the specified Class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The specified Class to parse
        node - The InfoNode
        Returns:
        The most specific Class when the specified Class is a subtype of the Class found in the InfoNode object. Otherwise, returns the Class found in the InfoNode object. If the Class found in the InfoNode is null, then returns the specified Class.

      • getNodeBuilderClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getNodeBuilderClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                     java.lang.String fieldName)
        Retrieves the NodeBuilder Class associated with the field name of the specified Class. If the field name isn't part of the specified class, then returns an exception. Returns Persist.Null if no NodeBuilder Class was specified in the annotation.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The specified Class that contains the specified field name
        fieldName - The name of the field for which to return the NodeBuilder Class.
        Returns:
        The NodeBuilder Class associated with the annotation, or Persist.Null if no NodeBuilder Class was specified in the annotation.

      • getNodeBuilderClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getNodeBuilderClass(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
        /** Retrieves the NodeBuilder Class associated with the field name of the specified Class. If the field name isn't part of the specified class, then returns an exception. Returns Persist.Null if no NodeBuilder Class was specified in the annotation.
        Parameters:
        field - The field for which to retrieve the associated NodeBuilder.
        Returns:
        The NodeBuilder Class associated with the annotation, or Persist.Null if no NodeBuilder Class was specified in the annotation.

      • getItemOrAncestorCopyable

        public static <T extends Copyable<T>> T getItemOrAncestorCopyable(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,T> items)
        Finds the item associated with the specified Class. If the specified class doesn't have an associated item, then it searches for the closest parent class (inheritance) and returns that. In this case, it adds an entry to the items map for the specified class associating it with the returned item (performance speed-up for subsequent calls).
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to find a item
        Returns:
        the item associated with the specified Class

      • getItemOrAncestor

        public static <T> T getItemOrAncestor(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,T> items)
        Finds the item associated with the specified Class. If the specified class doesn't have an associated item, then it searches for the closest parent class (inheritance) and returns that. In this case, it adds an entry to the items map for the specified class associating it with the returned item (performance speed-up for subsequent calls).
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class for which to find a item
        Returns:
        the item associated with the specified Class

      • getDeclaredFields

        private static final java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getDeclaredFields(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                        java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> fields)
        Recursive method to grab all the declared fields from the specified class and its super classes.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class for which to return the declared fields
        fields - The list of fields for the specified class, to which we add the fields of the super class
        Returns:
        the declared fields from the specified class and its super classes.

      • getDeclaredField

        public static final java.lang.reflect.Field getDeclaredField(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                       java.lang.String fieldName)
                                                      throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Returns the specified declared field from the specified class or its ancestors.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class from which to find the field of the specified name
        fieldName - The name of the declared field
        Returns:
        the specified declared field from the specified class or its ancestors.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if no field with the specified name is found in the specified class or ancestor classes
